description: 5 strategic frameworks for seeing business problems through new lenses
overview: Mental models are how we think about problems. Most people use the same tired frameworks everyone else uses. These 5 models come from physics, cross-industry pattern recognition, and first principles thinking. They reveal what conventional wisdom misses.

demand-model.summary: What people say they want and what they actually buy are rarely the same thing. Growth is demand-driven. Start with demand and everything realigns.
demand-model.core_principle: See yourself through customer eyes. The Reversal: Companies create systems for themselves. Successful companies look at business through customer eyes.
demand-model.when_relevant: Growth challenges, product-market fit, customer behavior confusion, marketing that doesn't convert, sales resistance

incentives-model.summary: People don't do what you want them to do. They do what they're incentivized to do. Water always finds its way. So do incentives.
incentives-model.core_principle: Don't fight human nature, design for it. Watch what gets rewarded, punished, celebrated. That's what drives behavior.
incentives-model.when_relevant: Organizational behavior, culture problems, why strategies fail, misaligned teams, unexpected outcomes

agentic-model.summary: AI that waits for instructions is a faster intern. AI that acts with purpose is a force multiplier. Technology moving from executing commands to pursuing objectives.
agentic-model.core_principle: Design the sandbox, let agents play. The bottleneck isn't the AI - it's your need to feel in control.
agentic-model.when_relevant: AI strategy, automation, scaling problems, delegation challenges, how to use AI effectively

prismatic-model.summary: Every industry thinks it's special. None of them are. Breakthroughs come from adjacent spaces. Your real competitors solve your type of problem better, regardless of domain.
prismatic-model.core_principle: Cross-industry pattern recognition. Nightclubs and enterprise sales are both gatekeeping. Airports and emergency rooms are both triage under constraints.
prismatic-model.when_relevant: Innovation questions, competitive strategy, finding new approaches, learning from other industries

triptych-model.summary: Marketing is how you're found. Technology is how you deliver. Game theory is how you win. Most see them as separate. They're one system.
triptych-model.core_principle: Marketing = space between who you are and who knows you exist. Technology = making impossible things boring. Game theory = knowing what game you're playing.
triptych-model.when_relevant: Business strategy, competitive positioning, integration questions, holistic thinking, multi-dimensional problems

usage_note: Models are lenses, not rules. Apply the right model to the right problem. Sometimes you need multiple models simultaneously. The art is knowing which lens reveals what's hidden.
